insight_cards.title: Titles analysed
insight_cards.description: Curated catalogue entries spanning films and series from 2014-2021.

insight_cards.title: Countries represented
insight_cards.description: A globally diverse line-up with heavy representation from emerging markets.

insight_cards.title: Top genre
insight_cards.description: 21 appearances across the library, driven by international audiences.

insight_cards.title: Peak release year
insight_cards.description: 16 titles launched, marking the catalogue's fastest growth year.

narrative.heading: Global reach is accelerating
narrative.detail: 95.0% of the catalogue now comes from outside the United States, signalling a deliberate localisation strategy.

narrative.heading: Genre investments favour documentaries and dramas
narrative.detail: Documentary-led genres take 16 slots in the top-performing categories, pairing with drama formats for cross-market appeal.

narrative.heading: Consistent year-on-year growth
narrative.detail: Annual releases grew from 1 titles in 2014 to 16 launches by 2021, underscoring resilient production pipelines.

workflow.detail: Parsed Netflix title exports, standardised multi-select fields, and resolved geographic duplicates with Python.
Profiled release cadence, geographic spread, and genre depth to uncover high-level patterns using notebook-ready scripts.
Built a Power BI storyboard to translate metrics into stakeholder-friendly visuals and executive insights.

recommendations: Double down on documentary and drama formats in South Korea, India, and Brazil where engagement is accelerating.
Prototype cross-genre bundles (music + documentary) for LATAM markets to test retention lifts.
Leverage Power BI dashboards for monthly content planning reviews alongside regional leads.
